text: in the midst of gloom which you might
call depression we need something to
make us smile and nobody no filmmaker
does that I think more reliably than
Charlie Chaplin in city lights Chaplin
is at the top of his game both as a
comic performer and also as a filmmaker
his mastery of the syntax of camera
movement and performance is really
unmatched in this movie it's full of
wonderful sight gags and bits of visual
humor and every single scene is really a
perfectly executed set piece
if something has to hold all of these
madcap moments together and in this case
it's a charming romance between The
Little and a blind flower seller
after falling for her he reads about an
operation that might restore her
eyesight and sets about trying to get
the money to pay for that surgery
Charlie manages somewhat miraculously to
come up with the money but before he can
see the results of his generosity and
before the girl can see her benefactors
face he has to vanish from her life this
simple even corny premise gives the
movie it's wonderful sweetness and
elevates the comedy to the level of
poetry the Little may be hapless
and foolish but he's also decent kind
brave and even heroic these are
qualities that even the blind girl
recognizes when they meet for the very
first time after her sight has been
